business.headline: Why most early retirement plans fail: Expert breaks down the real problemMost people chasing early retirement don't fail because they earn too little, they fail because they rely on assumptions that don't hold up in real life. An expert explains where FIRE plans usually go wrong.

Airbus hit by fresh A320 production flaw as global fleet undergoes fixes: ReportThe latest snag comes just as airlines worldwide, including Indian carriers, rush through emergency software upgrades ordered after regulators flagged a flight-control vulnerability linked to solar radiation.

Govt moves to retain high taxes on tobacco, pan masala with new excise, cess billsThe Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, proposes fresh excise duties on all tobacco products, while the Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, seeks a new cess on pan masala and other notified sin goods.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 64.77 points lower at 85,641.90, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 27.20 points down at 26,175.75. Broader market indices also weakened as volatility ticked up and investors booked profits following a record-setting rally last week.

Will RBI announce a 25 bps rate cut? What to expect from the upcoming MPC meetingWith inflation staying unusually low and the economy showing strong growth, expectations of a small rate cut have gathered pace.

Will, gift deed or trust: Which is the best way to pass on your wealth?Most families believe a will is enough, but the truth is more complicated. Knowing when to use a will, gift deed or trust can determine whether your wealth transfers smoothly or breaks down in disputes.

How lifestyle inflation, not low income, is hurting your savings? Explains expertMost people blame low income for their poor savings, but financial experts point to something else entirely, i.e., lifestyle inflation. Each upgrade, no matter how small, reduces the space for savings. Is this holding you back too?

Silver hits record high as gold shines. What's behind the latest bullion rally?The precious metals market is buzzing again as silver hits a fresh record high and gold continues its steady climb. What's fuelling this powerful bullion rally?

Cancer patients in India face health insurance crisis, finds new studyCancer patients are facing a health insurance crisis. A new study finds early detection rising but coverage thinning, leaving households to manage high bills, multiple claims and growing out-of-pocket expenses.

How smart investors maintain liquidity without compromising returnsResearch shows that portfolios with disciplined liquidity management outperform those with static cash holdings during market stress.

From ITR to TDS: 4 key income tax deadlines you can't miss in DecemberWith multiple tax compliances due this month, December demands careful attention from individuals and businesses alike. These four deadlines are the ones you can't afford to miss.

Lenskart share price jumps 5% after Q2 results. Here's all you need to knowLenskart's share price climbed to nearly 5% on the Bombay Stock Exchange around 9:37 am, reflecting renewed investor confidence following one of its best quarterly performances since listing.

Sensex, Nifty scale fresh peaks as Q2 GDP surprise lifts market moodBoth the S&P BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 touched fresh all-time highs in early trade. By 9:24 am, the Sensex was up 309.06 points at 86,015.73, while the Nifty50 rose 84.50 points to 26,287.45.

From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

entertainment.headline: Dia Mirza calls out Bollywood's age bias, and how only men get to age into romance Dia Mirza addressed ageism in the Indian film industry. She discussed her latest projects, and highlighted the need to have a more inclusive industry, where men and women are given equal opportunities without age biases.

Dia Mirza grieves heartbreaking devastation caused by floods in Southeast Asia Actor Dia Mirza expressed solidarity for the victims of floods in Sri Lanka, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia. Amid the devastating tropical storms, she also alerted about the consequences of climate change.

Animal turns two: Anil Kapoor shares BTS pics with Ranbir, Sandeep Reddy Vanga As Animal completed two years, Anil Kapoor shared behind-the-scenes moments and reflected on the film's impact, calling it a project that "erupted" on release.

Who is Raj Nidimoru, filmmaker married to Samantha Ruth Prabhu? Amid reports of his wedding to Samantha Ruth Prabhu, filmmaker Raj Nidimoru comes into the spotlight, prompting renewed interest in his personal background and career.

Bhumika Chawla leads Gunasekhar's Euphoria, check release date here  After large-scale period films like Rudramadevi and Shaakuntalam, director Gunasekhar returns with a new-age psychological thriller led by Bhumika Chawla and Gautham Menon.

Venkatesh shoots song for Chiranjeevi's Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu. See pic A viral BTS picture of Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh from a special song in Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu has amplified the buzz around the Sankranthi 2026 entertainer.

Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai completes 5000 episodes, makers release special promo Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai has completed 5000 episodes, becoming the first Indian daily fiction show to reach this milestone. A special promo has been released highlighting the show's journey across its various generations of characters.

Perfect Family review: A real, raw look at imperfect relationshipsRelease Date:Thu Nov 27, 2025 Perfect Family series review: Pankaj Tripathi's Perfect Family focusses on a dysfunctional Karkaria family seeking therapy. One of the show's biggest strengths is its stellar ensemble cast, whose performances bring depth and authenticity to the story.

Saba Azad calls herself and Hrithik Roshan hungry hippos in adorable travel post Saba Azad shared a travel video with Hrithik Roshan, sharing that their biggest reason for exploring the world together is their love for food. She also recommended their favourite ramen spot in Barcelona while sharing fun details about their foodie adventures.

Manoj Bajpayee opens up on being underpaid compared to Shah Rukh and Salman Khan In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Manoj Bajpayee opened up about being 'underpaid' compared to mega stars, humorously calling himself a 'cheap labour' while prioritising artistic passion for smaller films.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday pose on the sets of Kaun Banega Crorepati 17. Photos Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Pandey were clicked on the sets of 'Kaun Bannega Crorepati 17' They will next be seen in Sameer Vidwans' 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'.

Chinmayi sorry for collab with director Mohan G, linked to allegedly casteist films Chinmayi has issued a public apology following criticism for her involvement as a singer in Tamil director Mohan G's upcoming film Droupadi 2. She faced backlash because of the director's alleged support for casteism and honour killings in previous films.

NTRNeel in toughest shoot phase, Jr NTR's dons fierce look for key action stretch As Jr NTR's fierce new transformation dominates social media, 'NTRNeel' enters its toughest production phase yet with an intense night-shoot schedule rolling out at Ramoji Film City.

What went wrong with One Punch Man for Gen Z audiences In this week's Animania, we discover why One Punch Man failed to resonate with Generation Z audiences. From changing humour trends to pacing issues and long release gaps, we explore how the anime's parody style no longer matches the tastes of modern viewers.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Rajath, Chaithra enter as wildcards, Jhanvi evicted Former participants from Season 11 joined the Bigg Boss Kannada 12 house again during the previous week as guests, with Rajath and Chaitra Kundapur staying back as surprise wildcard contestants, shaking up the competition announced by host Kichcha Sudeep

Samantha-Raj Nidimoru wedding: All eyes on bride's ring and minimalist mangalsutra Samantha and Raj Nidimoru's intimate Coimbatore wedding photos are now viral on social media, with the actor's intricate engagement ring and traditional thaali mangalsutra stealing the spotlight.

They talk, we laugh: Mrunal Thakur on dating rumours with Dhanush, Shreyas Iyer Mrunal Thakur has finally reacted to the ongoing speculation about her personal life. After rumours linking her first to Dhanush and now to cricketer Shreyas Iyer circulated online, the actor shared a light-hearted Instagram video featuring her mother, seemingly laughing off the buzz.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 84: Sanjana faces heat, Divya eliminated The weekend episode delivered a mix of humour and heavy emotions as fun tasks gave way to tough judgments, culminating in Divya Velamuri's emotional exit.

Samantha marries filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in Coimbatore. See pics Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre, with the ceremony attended by a small group of guests on Monday.

general news.headline: Brother took cops' taunt as dare, killed him: Woman who 'married' boyfriend's bodyAachal demanded the death penalty for her parents and brothers, accusing them of conspiring to kill Saksham after his release from jail. She also alleged that her family had been threatening her and targeted Saksham because he belonged to a Scheduled Caste community.

PM says delivery, not drama, needed in Parliament, Priyanka Gandhi hits backAfter Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the Opposition to focus on delivery and not drama in the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra hit back, saying raising issues in the House was not drama.

Did Virat Kohli avoid Gautam Gambhir after Ranchi ODI?IND vs SA: Is there a tension brewing between two of India's most senior players and Gautam Gambhir? Eagle-eyed fans have spotted Virat Kohli potentially snubbing Gambhir after the 1st ODI.

India orders phone companies to install govt cyber safety app in every phoneThe Indian government has reportedly sent an order privately instructing all major smartphone makers to preload a non-deletable, state-owned cybersecurity application, 'Sanchar Saathi,' on every new device within 90 days.

Samantha marries filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in Coimbatore. See picsActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre, with the ceremony attended by a small group of guests on Monday.

Can anti-India lawmaker Ilhan Omar be deported from US amid fraud claims?Allegations of marriage and immigration fraud against Ilhan Omar, known for her anti-India stand, have resurfaced again, and a section of American citizens are demanding her denaturalisation and deportation from the US. But is it possible to do so for a naturalised US citizen, who is also an elected Democratic representative?

Putin's India visit to revive big-ticket defence deals, new S-400 offer on tableAs Russian President Vladimir Putin is set for his first visit to India on December 4-5, since the Russia-Ukraine war, high-level defence cooperation and a new S-400 missile deal are expected to lead the agenda.

Amid BLO suicides, Election Commission faces heat over boogie woogie dance videoOver a dozen Booth-Level Officers (BLOs) involved in voter roll revision as part of the SIR exercise have died by suicide, reportedly due to work pressure. Amid this, a dance video posted by the Election Commission of India (ECI) has sparked outrage. People are calling the ECI tone-deaf and insensitive.

Why Jaya Bachchan's classist paparazzi remarks deserve pushbackJaya Bachchan's recent comments on paparazzi have been called classist and dismissive. Here's a deep dive into why her remarks cross the line and what they reveal about power and privilege.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

Is it Rahul, is it Modi? TMC MP Kirti Azad's riddle leaves people dividedA cryptic riddle shared by cricketer-turned-politician Kirti Azad has left people debating on whom the post is aimed at. In the post, Azad, a Trinamool Congress MP, asked who aspires to greatness like Nehru, Indira, and Manmohan but lacks their vision, courage, and education.

Another BLO dies by suicide, blamed SIR work pressure in heartbreaking videoA video of the BLO from Uttar Pradesh showed the distraught officer breaking down in tears, saying he is unable to finish his SIR job despite working hard.

Nandamuri Balakrishna at 65: Last man standing of the genre he shapedWhile most senior stars have moved to sleeker, subtler and more modern formats of storytelling, Nandamuri Balakrishna continues to headline films filled with physics-defying action and unapologetic mass extravagance.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Flights faced GPS spoofing near Delhi airport, government confirms in ParliamentThe Ministry of Civil Aviation has confirmed GPS spoofing and GNSS interference at Delhi and several other major airports, prompting flight disruptions and triggering heightened security and regulatory responses.

Video: Renuka Chowdhury brings dog to Parliament, says those who bite are insideIn an unprecedented move, Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury brought her pet dog into the Indian Parliament, stirring widespread debate on parliamentary norms. The incident has sparked discussions on privileges and decorum within the House.

How do people get scammed online? We talked to a scammerAlmost daily we see stories about people losing lakhs of rupees to some online scam or the other. Recently we got details of a scammer and then talked to him to understand how cyber scammer try to trap victims.

Switzerland votes to reject khatakhat khatakhat wealth-sharing planVoters in Switzerland, one of the wealthiest nations, have rejected a plan that was the litmus test for wealth redistribution. They voted out a plan that sought a 50% tax on inherited fortunes of $62 million or more. The socialist idea, similar to the Rahul Gandhi-championed khatakhat khatakhat plan, came amid anxiety over a high cost of living in Switzerland.

Discussion in Parliament on Vande Mataram's 150 years this week, PM likely to speakThe Parliament will hold a discussion on Vande Mataram as the national song completes 150 years. PM Modi is likely to speak during the discussion this week.

How trade war with poor Afghanistan is bleeding PakistanPakistan's decision to halt trade with Afghanistan, which defence minister Khwaja Asif said was "a blessing in disguise", is backfiring. This is why the ban is hitting Pakistan's own economy hard while the Taliban regime in Afghanistan is finding alternative routes and partners like India.
Samantha's bridal moment is proof the red saree never loses its magicSamantha swore by the timeless appeal of a traditional red Banarasi saree for her wedding to filmmaker Raj Nidimoru.

UP school teacher brutally slaps children, disturbing video sparks outrageThe viral video shows the teacher calling students one by one and slapping them hard, striking them with a stick and aggressively scolding them.

US hit 1.17 million foreign students, a record. But new arrivals fell sharplyThe Open Doors Report 2025 shows that the total international students in the US rose by 4.5% to a record 1,177,766. Yet new international enrolments fell by 7.2% to 277,118. Here's more about this twist.

Shubman Gill begins rehab ahead of South Africa T20Is IND vs SA: Shubman Gill's return to action now hinges on his COE fitness clearance after a three-week injury layoff. India await the medical report with the South Africa T20Is approaching quickly.

Travis Head ready to open in Brisbane amid Usman Khawaja's fitness concerns Travis Head is ready to open again in the second Ashes Test in Brisbane if required. His comments come amid fitness concerns for Usman Khawaja for the pink-ball Test.

Enjoy Rohit and Virat's cricket, stop worrying about World Cup: Pathan IND vs SA: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan wants the fans to enjoy the cricket of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, instead of worrying about their eligibility for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Pathan heaped praise on the senior batters after India's win over South Africa in the 1st ODI.

Don't know why Mohammed Shami is still not playing: Kaif says India misses pacer Mohammed Kaif questioned Mohammed Shami's absence from India's squad for the ODI series against South Africa. Kaif felt that Shami's experience could have helped India's young pace unit.

Felt like we went back 8-9 years: India teammates in awe of Kohli's Ranchi knock Virat Kohli's India teammates were left in awe of the star batter after his vintage hundred during the Ranchi ODI against South Africa on Sunday, November 30. Kohli scored his 52nd ODI hundred to help India win the match.

Lucas Paqueta slams FA after red card for lack of support in spot-fixing probe Lucas Paqueta condemned the FA's lack of psychological support following his red card against Liverpool. The midfielder, recently cleared of spot-fixing allegations, linked his on-pitch behaviour to the mental toll from the investigation.

F1 title showdown: How Norris, Verstappen and Piastri can win title in Abu DhabiThe Formula One 2025 season is set for a thrilling climax as Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri battle it out for the crown. Here's how all three drivers can walk away with the crown in the Abu Dhabi GP on December 7.

Don't judge Ruturaj Gaikwad for low scores until you make him open: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has called for giving Ruturaj Gaikwad a chance as an opener before judging his ODI career. The former cricketer also criticised the management for benching Rishabh Pant in the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi.

Without Kohli and Rohit, India had no chance vs South Africa in Ranchi: KaifMohammed Kaif has claimed that without the heroics from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, India would have lost the Ranchi ODI against South Africa. Kohli scored a hundred and Rohit hit a fifty as India won the match by 17 runs.

10-man Chelsea frustrate Arsenal, Liverpool end rot vs West HamChelsea held Arsenal to a 1-1 draw despite being reduced to ten men. Liverpool defeated West Ham 2-0, with Alexander Isak scoring his first Premier League goal for the club as the Reds ended a difficult stretch of form.

Grew up watching Kohli on TV, bowling to him is fun yet annoying: Marco JansenSouth Africa's Marco Jansen reflected on the difficulty and enjoyment of bowling to Virat Kohli after India's 17-run win in the opening ODI. Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred helped India take a 1-0 lead in the series, while Jansen shared candid insights into the challenge of facing the Indian star.

If not for Rana's early wickets, SA would've easily chased 350: Sitanshu KotakHarshit Rana's early wickets helped India defend 349 against South Africa in Ranchi. He finished the match with figures of 3/65 in ten overs helping India register a 17-run victory.

Indian team least bothered, concerned about SA coach's grovel remark: KotakIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak says the team is unfazed by South Africa coach, Shukhri Conrad's "grovel" remark after the Ranchi ODI, stressing focus remains on performance.

Don't ask any questions, Virat and Rohit have sealed World Cup spots: SrikkanthFormer India selector Kris Srikkanth feels that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have already sealed their spots for World Cup 2027 and no questions should be asked on their places in the squad for the tournament.

Harsha Bhogle reveals chat with Kohli before question on Test comeback rumoursIndian commentator Harsha Bhogle revealed his conversation with Virat Kohli before asking him about his Test comeback rumours. Despite speculation, Kohli confirmed he will continue playing only ODIs, ruling out a Test comeback.

Max Verstappen wins Qatar GP to ensure three-way title showdown in Abu DhabiMax Verstappen secured his third consecutive win at the Qatar Grand Prix, to push the championship battle into a three-way tussle inAbu Dhabi. Norris's lead was reduced to 12 points following a fourth-place finish, with McLaren's strategy calls under scrutiny.

Inside Kohli's ODI preparations: How India's 37-year-old master keeps dominatingIND vs SA, 1st ODI:  Despite the wealth of experience he carries and his status as an ODI great, Virat Kohli still believes the core of batting lies in the mind. He relies on visualising situations and feeling sharp and switched on, placing greater value on mental clarity than on long, repetitive preparation.

After Rohit Sharma, is Virat transforming his style to push for 2027 World Cup?IND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored a commanding hundred in the first of three ODIs against South Africa. The template of this century was quite different from the ones we have seen Kohli hit in his career.

Virat and Rohit have made oppositions look silly, fun to see them: KL RahulIndia skipper KL Rahul marvelled at how Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can make opposition attacks look "silly", praising the stalwarts after their defining knocks in the first ODI against South Africa on Sunday.

Rohit, Kohli for 2027 World Cup: India coach says focus on enjoying their form nowIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak dismissed speculation over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup futures, insisting the team is focused on enjoying their current form after India's 17-run win in Ranchi.

IND vs SA: Aiden Markram proud of Jansen, Bosch's valiant fight in Ranchi thrillerSouth Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed pride in his team's fightback despite a top-order collapse that left them chasing the match in their 17-run defeat to India in the first ODI in Ranchi. After crashing to 11 for 3, spirited innings from Marco Jansen, Matthew Breetzke and Corbin Bosch took the contest into the final over, reinforcing the Proteas' belief ahead of the next match.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
